attributes.action: The British public do not want a second Referendum on EU membership.
attributes.additional_details: Mr Camerons Chatham House Speech stating there would be no second referendum. http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/david-cameron-says-he-will-ask-eu-leaders-for-clear-legally-binding-commitment-to-exempt-uk-from-a6728181.html
attributes.background: Because the British electorate had a referendum on June 23rd and it was a victory for the leave campaign. Mr Cameron said there would be no second referendum if remain won but because his campaign lost they want to do it again.
